meta.name: description
meta.content: Welcome to the Toledo School District in Toledo, Washington. Our mission is to provide opportunities and meaningful experiences to empower students to achieve their goals. "Each child. Each day. Each classroom."

meta.name: generator

a.class: nonblock nontext MuseLinkActive clip_frame grpelem

img.alt: Toledo School District number 237. Each child, each day, each classroom.

div.p: All school facilities in the state will remain closed for on-site instruction for the remainder of the school year, according to an April 6, 2020 announcement from Washington Governor Jay Inslee and OSPI Superintendent Chris Reykdal.
We are developing new ways to instruct our students remotely and provide continuous learning during this closure. We continue to provide meal services by bus delivery.

• Coronavirus Meal Sign Up Form
All athletics and extra-curricular activities have been postponed and all use of school facilities are suspended until further notice.
Continue to watch our website, blog or Facebook page for updates on our response to this event.

div.p: Welcome to the Toledo School District in Toledo, Washington. Our mission is to provide opportunities and meaningful experiences to empower students to achieve their goals. "Each child. Each day. Each classroom."

img.alt: Nick Krallis of Freightliner Northwest told the Toledo Second Grade Safari some big rig safety tips and gave a tour of Optimus Prime's cousin.
Nick Krallis of Freightliner Northwest told the Toledo Second Grade Safari some big rig safety tips and gave a tour of Optimus Prime's cousin.
A high school student reads a book about Charles Dickens to a group of second grade students.
Toledo School Board members and student representatives break ground for the new high school with shovels at a ceremony on February 7, 2020.
Dr. Dione Schumacher of the Winlock Eyecare Clinic is assisted by Jeletsa Cuadra while visiting the Second Grade Safari at Toledo Elementary.
The Toepper family's "surrogoat" reindeer visited the THS Biology classes.
Students teach students during the second grade safari.
Joanne Marti talks to Mrs. Ketchum's career class about speech pathology.
ToledoTel representative John Britten explains how communication devices work during Second Grade Safari.
THS junior Nicholas Marty leads a cross country race. Photo by Grant Clark, LewisTalk.com.
Phil Marick demonstrates making cider for students with an apple press from 1860.
High school students visit the second grade to show plans for the new high school and share fables written by students.
High school students visit the second grade to show plans for the new high school and share fables written by students.

img.alt: Skyward logo with link to website

div.p: The Toledo School District uses Skyward to manage student, family and staff accounts.

a.span: THS Construction Project Invitation to Bid

div.p: Follow the Toledo School District on Facebook.com for updates on district activities: https://www.facebook.com/toledoschooldistrict/

img.alt: Native American artwork hangs around Toledo High School.

div.p: Native American artwork hangs around Toledo High School.

Toledo School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination:
Title IX Coordinator, Section 504/ADA Coordinator, Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator

p.span: Copyright © 2020 Toledo School District. All rights reserved.
Contact the District Office by calling 360-864-6325.
We are located at 116 Ramsey Way or by mail at P.O. Box 469, Toledo, WA 98591.

div.p: Site designed and powered by Morgan Online Media LLC.
